elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (UPPER LEVELS)
FX: THE RATTLING OF A SKELETON KEY IN A LARGE, RUSTY LOCK.
Come on, come on!
I’m going as fast as I can, Kevin. Here, you have a go.
(FX: MORE RATTLING IN THE LOCK — THIS TIME WITH MORE URGENCY. THE CLICK OF A LOCK AND THE SQUEAK OF AN OPENING METAL DOOR. )
Hah! There you go, Matthew! It’s all in the wrist action, you see. When I was in the Falklands they taught us all about things like that.
(MOCKING) They taught you about picking locks in the Falklands? Why?
I can’t answer that, Caitlin. I signed a form.
Right, so they made you sign a form that lets you talk when you want to impress us, then shut up when you’re about to expose your lack of first-hand knowledge.
What are you saying?
He’s saying he doesn’t believe you were in the Falklands and neither do I.
Do you realise how disrespectful that is? All my friends who died. All the things I saw...
On television.
Do you want my help or not? Don’t forget who brought you the map in the first place.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 4
So if we don’t stop being mean to you, you’ll go home and take your ball with you? This isn’t a game, Kevin.
I know, [it’s just —]

We could uncover something important here. People’s lives might have been endangered — things the public ought to know. This isn’t like being back at school, getting one over on the teachers — this is real life. OK?
Yes, I know.
FX: CROSS TO:
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 2. INT. THE LAIR OF THE KING RAT.
(FX: BACKGROUND COMPUTER HUMMING. DRIPPING WATER, STRIKING PUDDLES. NOTE, ALL RATS SPEAK ‘TELEPATHICALLY’, A EFFECT MIGHT BE NEEDED. KING RAT IS THREE RATS TOGETHER, SO WOULD HAVE A
OVERLAID ‘MULTIPLE VOICE’ EFFECT)
(VIA MONITOR) Then let’s get a move on, boys. (FX: MOVING OFF
An intrusion.
Rogue element. The experiment is invalid. Shall we destroy them?
No. May yet be interesting results from this. Watch them and record.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 3. INT. TARDIS. NYSSA’S ROOM.
No, no, NO!
(FX: THE SOUND OF TEST TUBES CRASHING AGAINST A WALL. THEN,
KNOCKING ON NYSSA’S DOOR)
(THROUGH DOOR) Nyssa? Are you all right?
I’m fine, Tegan.
FX: DOOR OPENS
(WALKS INTO ROOM) What the blazes happened here?
I dropped a test tube.
(DISBELIEVING) Right, it slipped out of your hand as you threw it against the wall. Come on Nyssa, we’re supposed to be friends!
Really, I’m fine.
No you’re not. What are you doing with all this gear? It looks like my old chemistry lab back at school!
I’m trying to isolate the Richter’s Syndrome virus. This was the best that I could find in the TARDIS. And it’s still not enough!
Richter’s? Why are you bothered about Richter’s?
After everything that happened on Samur, everything that happened to Turlough...
That boy. Since then, he’s not said a word about it. About her.
. Tegan, it’s time I went home.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 7
BEAT
Oh. Right. I — well, I guess you’d better talk to the Doctor about that. I only hope he can get you there.
The thing is, I need to take the Richter’s cure with me. I can’t leave everyone I love exposed to such a terrible disease.
But don’t you still have the cure we found on Hellheim?
Yes. But the vaccine is failing.
What do you mean? It worked fine on us!
That’s because we were injected as soon as it was created. But now it’s destabilising, and I don’t know how to stop it.
What do you mean, destabilising?
The binary strands are degrading, the protein base is losing cohesion... Soon we’1ll have nothing.
Then we’ll fix it. We all had the vaccine injected into us, so perhaps our blood holds the key? You know, to restabilising the whatsits in your vaccine?
I suppose that might be an option...
Come on, the Doctor asked me to find you. Apparently he has a plan that’1ll brighten our day.
Getting home would brighten my day.
I said a plan, not a miracle.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 4: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (UPPER LEVELS)
(FX: AS BEFORE. CAITLIN, KEVIN AND MATTHEW ARE WALKING THROUGH THE TUNNELS. THE CLICK-CLICK OF A TORCH’S ON/OFF BUTTON)
(PAUSING) Huh. This ex-military torch you gave me is an ex- torch. One of you aim yours down the tunnel — I can’t see my hand in front of my face...
FX: A CLICK OF A LIGHTSWITCH AND THE DULL HUM OF ELECTRICITY
Or we could just flip the light switch.
So these tunnels, supposedly abandoned since the 1960s, still have a working generator?
Wait a minute. Do you think this place is still active?
Could be.
Well this changes things, doesn’t it? I mean, there could be people here...
Yes, there could.
You sound excited.

‘Secret military experiments happened thirty years ago’ is a good story. ‘Secret military experiments happening right now under your nose’ is time to pick out a nice frock to wear to the awards ceremony.
Why, Kevin? Are you scared?
No, it’s just... a mission is only as good as its intelligence.
Did they teach you that in the Falklands?
It’s common sense. This wasn’t what we prepared for.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 9
If we’d known, what would we have done differently? Gone in armed? I don’t think so.
She’s right, Kevin. Turn back if you want, but after two hours trudging [through these —]
No, I don’t want to go back.
Right then. We’1ll just have to be a bit more cautious, that’s all. Come on.
FX: THE THREE OF THEM START WALKING
(WALKING) I never thought I’d even see a picture of these tunnels, let alone be in them!
Is it a telephone exchange? Those switchboards almost look brand new.
(WALKING) Get this map out then, Kevin. Let’s see how accurate at 1S’
(PAUSES TO A STOP) Wait a mo.. it’s in my rucksack.
FX: RUMMAGING IN A BAG
(SHOCKED) Whoa whoa whoa! Stop right there! What was that I just saw? Was that dynamite in your bag?
Yes.
What are you playing, at bringing that with you?
I just thought if we couldn’t pick the locks, we should have a back-up plan. I put it together myself. Some dynamite, some nitro-glycerine...
I wondered before, but now I know for sure: Kevin, you’re insane!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 5. INT. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM. )
FX: THE HUM OF THE TARDIS IN FLIGHT
Ah, Tegan, you found Nyssa!
Tegan said you had something that might... Brighten our day, Doctor?
I have indeed! The TARDIS is being a bit stubborn with temporal calibrations past the twenty-first century at the moment, so while it self-rectifies that, I thought we should go on a field trip!
Knowing you, that means a trip... to a field.
Turlough, what have you and the Doctor been planning?
Don’t look at me, he’s been talking about this all morning.
Cadogan Castle! Oh, you’1ll love it, Nyssa! Eleven Twenty-Three. Smack bang in the middle of the age of chivalry!
‘In days of old, when Knights were bold.’
Yes, I remember the Knights I met in Stockbridge.
Ah, but — this was the very day that the Treaty of The Marshes was Signed! History in the making! Well, already made, really. But there’1ll be feasts, and dancing, jousting...
I saw a Ren Fayre in Sydney once. They had jousting. Two fat guys, half drunk on lager. Funniest thing I ever saw.
What is this... jousting?
Well, you have two men in plate armour, on horses. They line up, facing each other down a long, narrow course...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 11
And then they charge at full speed, trying to spear each other with a long wooden pole.
That sounds barbaric!

(CLICKING SWITCHES ON THE CONSOLE) Thank you, Turlough. Actually it’s much more fun than it sounds. They try to knock each other off the horses rather than run each other through. Strategy and skill. Even the Kings were known to joust. (BEAT) But it’1ll be fun! And let’s face it, we could all do with a bit of fun now, couldn’t we? There are jugglers and archery contests...
We can stick Turlough in the stocks and throw fruit at him...
Yes. Marvellous. I’1l just go and shoot myself now, shall I?
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 6. INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (TARDIS CORRIDOR).
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES, DOOR OPENS.
Ah. The TARDIS seems to have... overshot the mark, somewhat.
(EXITING THE TARDIS) You think? An old tunnel’s not quite my idea of a grand day out, Doctor.
(EXPLORING) The walls are well made, the tunnel has a perfect arch above us! Look at that! Interesting tiling pattern, too...
There’s electric lighting as well. A desk and a typewriter. I don’t think we’re when you think we are, Doctor.
Yes, that does put us a bit further ahead than I thought...
(INTERRUPTING) What was Operation Daylight?
Daylight? It was a covert Allied mission during the Second World War... Where did you get that from?
Papers on the desk. See?
FX: RUSTLING PAPER
(WALKING TO THE DESK) Operation Daylight! Well, at least we’re in the right place, anyway!
How did you come to that conclusion?

Operation Daylight was a Second World War attempt at liberating France. It was controlled from a set of underground war rooms deep in the cliffs under Cadogan Castle! Right place, just the wrong time!
Well, it seems deserted.
No it’s not. I think I hear voices...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 7. INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (UPPER LEVELS).
You idiot, Kevin.
Look, I’m sorry I didn’t tell you about the explosives. Stop going on about it.
You could kill us all!
I’m going to kill him in a minute.
If you slip and fall, they could go off.
(BEAT) Really?
Yes. And setting anything off down here would only bring the whole tunnel down on [our heads —]
FX: A SKITTERING, RAT-LIKE NOISE.
What was that?
What was what?
I heard something move.
It’s probably a rat.
It sounded too big to be a rat.
Probably a very big rat then.
You think someone’s watching us?
It didn’t sound like a person either.
I see him! Over there, by the wall!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 14
You’re right, there is someone.
I told you, it didn’t sound —
(CALLS) I’m warning you, we’ve got explosives.
Shh! (CALLS) Look, ignore him — we’re not going to blow you up. We're just... we wanted to ask —
He isn’t moving. I’m telling you, it wasn’t him I heard.
FX: WALKING
Are you all right?
Be careful! It could be a trap, he could be pretending, he could be...
(FX: TAPPING ON A SHOULDER, THEN THE THUMP OF A BODY HITTING THE FLOOR. )
Dead.
(SCREAMS) Oh GOD!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 8: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (TARDIS CORRIDOR)
FX: KEVIN’S SCREAM ECHOES THROUGH TO THEM HERE
Sounds like someone’s in trouble.
We should go and help.
Do we all have to go?
No, I’ll check whether it’s safe first. You stay here.
FX: DOCTOR STRIDES AWAY
Wait — you’re not going on your own, I’m coming with you. You two, stay here.
FX: TEGAN FOLLOWS
No complaints from me.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 9: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (UPPER LEVELS)
Are you all right now, Kevin?
(IRRITABLY) Yes. It just gave me a bit of a flashback, that’s all.
He’s dead, all right. Looks like he’s been like that for hours. Army uniform.
These seem like defensive wounds — he was defending himself against something.
What though?
I dunno. But judging from the cuts to his face and arms, I'd say about the size of a small dog, perhaps?
You think there’s any more of them?
Any more soldiers, or any more of whatever killed this one?
If there’s military down here, this place must still be active.
Probably clearing the place out before it gets handed over.
Clearing out stuff they don’t want us to see perhaps?
Could be.
Maybe we should call the police.
FX: APPORACHING FOOTSTEPS
Someone’s coming.
And say what? ‘I’m sorry, officer, but while breaking into the Cadogan War Tunnels, I came across this dead soldier’?
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 17
FX: DOCTOR AND TEGAN ENTER
. and before you know it, you’re the one under suspicion. I do sympathise, happens to me all the time. Why don’t you tell me what happened?
Who are you?
Who screamed? Was it you?
No, it was him.
You didn’t have to tell him that.
Who are you? I assume you’re not army, dressed like that...
I’m the Doctor and this is my friend Tegan.
Doctor of what?
Oh, you know, this and that. Things that end in an ‘ology’, that sort of thing. (EXAMINING CORPSE) Not a lot I can do for this chap, unfortunately...
Those wounds look horrible. Ugh.
Mmm. (TO KEVIN) Now, you found the body, didn’t you? That can cause deep subconscious shock. Can you tell me the date?
I’m sorry?
Just a simple test. If you could tell me the exact date.
June the ninth, nineteen eighty three.
General Election day. It’1ll be a landslide, if I remember right.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 18
How would you know that? The polls have only been open for six hours!
It’s the government, man! They’re fixing the votes!
No. I think you’re not meant to be here either, are you? (TO OTHERS) I think they’re here for the same reason we are.
Which is what?

To find out the truth about these tunnels. I’m Matthew Dunbar from the Urban Explorers Collective, we check out disused and forgotten places in towns and cities. I’ve been interested in these tunnels for years.
There’s been rumours of government experiments here. Dodgy stuff. Weapons. I’m Kevin Wilde — I met Matthew through the group and brought him this map.
And where did you get the map from?
I’d rather not say.

He likes his air of mystery. I’m Caitlin Jones, freelance journalist. I talked to Matthew about these tunnels when I did a piece on his group a couple of years ago. When he decided to come down here he invited me along.
So these tunnels are supposed to be closed off? Shut down?
You must know that, if you managed to get in here.
We got in by accident.
How?
Never mind. So you’re simply curious and you came down here to investigate? Excellent. I approve of that.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 19
We were expecting it to be deserted though. We didn’t expect to find the lights still working, or dead soldiers on the floor.
No. Something is still going on down here. Shall we find out what?
You’re taking this very lightly.

I assure you, I’m not. I never take death lightly. But for me, the decision to get involved is never very difficult. [We should cover the body, then let’s find Nyssa and Turlough and get to the bottom of this, shall we?]
FX: CROSSFADE TO:
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 10: INT. THE LAIR OF THE KING RAT.
(FX: BACKGROUND COMPUTER HUMMING. DRIPPING WATER, STRIKING PUDDLES. NOTE, ALL RATS SPEAK ‘TELEPATHICALLY’, A EFFECT MIGHT BE NEEDED. KING RAT IS THREE RATS TOGETHER, SO WOULD HAVE A
OVERLAID ‘MULTIPLE VOICE’ EFFECT)
(THROUGH SPEAKER) We should cover the body, then let’s find Nyssa and Turlough and get to the bottom of this, shall we?
More intruders. Stranger different to the others. He knows something. He speaks of date. The result of election. There is something more there.
We cannot discover where he came from. He and his companions simply appeared in the lower levels.
(FROM OFF, WEAK AND FEEBLE) Please... Let me die...
Ah, Wallace. Death not for quite a while. More experiments needed for you.
No... I beg you...
Should we examine this new specimen closer?
No, Technician Fifteen. This is interesting. We want to see what he does next.
FX: A MONITOR PING OF ALERT
Three more specimens approaching from the south. About to intersect with two specimens in lower tunnels.
The civil servant and his woman. The third is their warrior. This should be amusing.
Stop this... let them go... You have me...
Ask nicely.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 21
Please... let them go.
No! Hahaha! Mutoids! Come!
(STUMBLING FORWARD, ZOMBIE-LIKE) Whurrrrghh...
No! Get these monsters off me!
Is that way to talk to your colleagues, Doctor Wallace? Take him to his cell!
No! Let me die!
FX: DOCTOR WALLACE STRUGGLES, PROTESTING AS HE DRAGGED AWAY
What do you want to do with these new specimens?
Trap them. Like rats. Start security measure. Lock bunker down.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 11: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (TARDIS CORRIDOR)
Turlough — look at this.
A dead rat. In an old abandoned tunnel. Who’d have thought it?
It’s much larger than a normal Terran rat... There’s something strange here. Would you pass me a pen please?
FX: HE HANDS HER A PEN
There you go.
Thanks.
FX: SHE POKES IT WITH THE PEN
What are you doing?
Checking that it’s dead. Which it is. There you go.
No no, you keep it.
Clear a space on the table.
You’re not going to pick it up, are you?
Please, Turlough, this might be important.
FX: TURLOUGH MOVES PAPERS
Thank you.
FX: SHE PICKS UP THE RAT AND PUTS IT ON THE DESK
Why is it so interesting to you?
Look at the size of its head.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 23
Maybe it’s got some kind of disease. Leave it alone — we’ve had enough of that recently.
Look at the cranial distribution. That’s not a product of natural evolution.
You lost me at ‘cranial distribution’.
It has a larger skull. Presumably, to house a much larger brain. Cauterised skin, and metal under the surface. Looks like it’s been operated on.
Yes, maybe. But who would —
FX: THE KA-CHICK OF A RIFLE BEING COCKED AS HARRIS ENTERS
Step away from the rat.
Why?
Because I don’t want you throwing it at me, that’s why. Anything can be a weapon in the right hands. Speaking of which, put them in the air.
We’re not here to cause trouble.
Oh no, of course not. And you wouldn’t know anything about the disappearance of three of my men in the past 24 hours, would you?
No, we wouldn’t. We didn’t even know you had any men.
Haven’t seen Peterson since this morning. He was the last of my squad. I’m just left with the pen-pushers now.
Pen-pushers?
FX: ANDREWS AND SALLY ENTER
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 24
Major Harris means us.
Can one of you manage to keep them covered while I check them for hidden weapons?
Yes, give me the gun.
FX: HARRIS PASSES THE GUN TO HER
You first.
(BEING MANHANDLED) There’s no need to be so aggressive.
And what are you two doing down here?
Er.. we got lost.
I see.
I don’t remember seeing this blue door before. Where does it go?
Let’s worry about them for the moment.
This one’s clear.
FX: HARRIS MOVES ON TO TURLOUGH
We’ve only just arrived. We don’t know what he’s talking about — who are you anyway?
Clifford Andrews. Home Office. That’s Sally Lucas, my P.A. They’re selling this place to the English Heritage next month, and we were sent down here to make sure it’s clear of anything sensitive.
But then Major Harris’ men started disappearing.
FX: HARRIS FINISHES INSPECTION, STRAIGHTENS UP
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 25
This one’s clear too. Yes. Three men, all vanished since yesterday afternoon. What have you done with them? Dead? Or have you got them tied up somewhere?
Nyssa’s told you the truth — we’ve only just arrived, we don’t know anything.
We'll see about that. You’re not going anywhere.
FX: HARRIS RATTLES HANDCUFFS
I don’t think handcuffs are necessary!
[ TURLOUGH: (FX: BEING HANDCUFFED THROUGH:) This is all we need. ]
FX: CROSS TO:
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 12: INT. THE LAIR OF THE KING RAT.
(VIA MONITOR) (FX: BEING HANDCUFFED THROUGH: ) This is all we need.
See the aggression of Harris. He wants revenge!

The other humans are not afraid. Both have been threatened many times before. ‘Nyssa’ is very interesting. She seems filled with guilt over something called Richter’s.. It seems to be some kind of plague. The ‘Turlough’ only wishes to be somewhere else, safe and warm.
A Plague? Interesting. And the others?
The ‘Tegan’ worries about the tunnel collapsing on her. The Doctor... We cannot read his thoughts. There is a block.
We would like to hear more. Attend them. Find what you can before we take them. Technician Fifteen? Secure base.
Yes.
FX: BEEP BOOP BOOP
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 13: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (LOWER LEVELS)
(FX: NEAR THE TARDIS CORRIDOR. DOCTOR, TEGAN, CAITLIN, KEVIN AND MATTHEW WALKING THROUGH )
Just down here, wasn’t it Tegan?
I don’t know, we were going so fast. [I think —]
FX: THE SLAM OF METAL DOORS AND A SIREN BLARING
What’s going on?
The base is going into lockdown! What did you do?
Don’t look at us!
What do you mean, lockdown?

After the Second World War, the Cadogan War Tunnels were obsolete, but with the arrival of the Cold War, the government needed nuclear shelters for the cabinet. Dover Castle, Cadogan, they made about five bunkers just like this, fitted them up with automatic doors and airlocks.
That’s what I heard. In the case of a nuclear war, the Prime Minister was to enter one, it would close behind him —
Or her.
—and he or she, and his or her aides would be safe. I didn’t know this was one.
Well, they do try to keep these things a secret.
Then how do you know?
So they’ve dropped the bomb on Election Day? When we’re all distracted, of course!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 28
(RUNNING TO A DOOR) Let’s not jump to conclusions. Maybe something’s set it off accidentally, or...
We won’t be able to get to Nyssa, or Turlough — or the TARDIS! Can you stop it, Doctor?
FX: THE FINAL, DISTANT CLUNG OF METAL, THE SIRENS STOP.
That sounded like the surface door. We’re locked in.
We’re trapped down here?
There’s always a way out, Kevin. We just have to find it. After all, the air’s still flowing through the ventilation shaft —
I don’t think it is, Doctor.
Really? (WALKS TO VENTILATION SHAFT) You’re right! That could be a problem.
Forgive me, Doctor... But you seem to be enjoying this.
He does that.
We’1ll work out how to open the doors.
But there could be half a dozen of them between us and the surface.
But only one between us and the TARDIS. Get through there, then a short locational hop and we’1ll be out of here in no time.
Now you’re just talking gibberish.
Most probably. Right then. Unfortunately I don’t have my toolbox with me, so I’1ll just have to make do with what’s in my pockets.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 29
I’ve got a skeleton key.
Yes.. I think we might need something a little cleverer than that.
Maybe there’s still a way out down one of these other tunnels?
I doubt it, but you never know. Best to check all options.
I’1l go with you.
Me too.
Really, Kevin?
Why not? I just don’t want to stand still when I could be doing something useful.
All right, but the Rucksack of Death stays here.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 14: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (TARDIS CORRIDOR)
FX: HARRIS CHECKING DOOR
No good. It’s locked.
So how do we get out?
If the Bomb’s really gone off, I suggest we don’t bother.
Bomb?
It’s possible that Armageddon has happened up there.
I doubt it. There’s no sign of the PM, is there? It’s probably been triggered by mistake. There’s a radio over there, I’1l get on it and find out. Watch these two.
So what did you do that got you into trouble, then?
I’m sorry? What?
Just seems a rum job, I wondered what you’d done to get yourself stationed here.
Nothing, I volunteered for it.
Volunteered?
Yes. I’ve worked under Clifford — Mr Andrews that is — before, when he took this post I asked to be considered for his PA.
Really? But it’s a bit of a no-hoper isn’t it?
Oh and you’d know all about that, wouldn’t you? Look at your school uniform, the wing collar... What is it, Eton?
Brendon, actually.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 31
School dorms and sons of presidents, I bet!
Look, I don’t see what this has to do with —

I was born in London. The South West. It’s supposed to be the posh part, but there’s a lot of council estates there too. When I was sixteen I left school, a lot of us did. Most of the girls I knew got pregnant, ended up on the social and housing benefit. But not me.
You didn’t like the... social?

No. I didn’t want to be one of the millions of unemployed. I worked my way up. Four years typing, delivering letters, making tea.. and then Mr Andrews sees me. Takes me under his wing. In one year I moved higher up the food chain than I did the first four combined. I’m twenty-one and I’m the peer of people almost double my age. And I did it without a degree or an ‘old school tie’. Because I volunteer for ‘rum old jobs’ like this.
All right, consider me told. Although believe it or not, I’m not your usual kind of public schoolboy, either.
How about you, Mr Harris?
I was stationed here. Orders are orders.
But you seem decked out for a full scale war! Grenades, assault rifle, pistol...
Major Harris here heard a few rumours about these tunnels before he came.
They’re not rumours, I’ve seen them.
There may be something down here.
I’ve seen them.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 32
Seen what?
Like people, but covered in patches of fur. They lumber around the tunnels...
Don’t you think those might be responsible for the disappearances of your men, rather than us?
They stay in the shadows. Don’t come close to us. I’ve never managed to catch one. I think someone’s helping them.
And you haven't... er...
Nyssa, are you alright?
What? Yes, sorry — it’s just that these corridors... they remind me of Hellheim. And the rat... Everywhere I go I seem to be looking at plague and corridors...
(SOFT, IN NYSSA’S MIND) So much loss... All those people dying... family forgotten... How can you live like that...
Did you hear that?
Hear what?
That voice?
Nyssa, are you all right? There was no voice.
No... sorry.. I could have sworn that I heard.. No, it’s nothing.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 15: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (LOWER LEVELS)
Are you sure we’re going the right way?
Kevin? What does the map say?
It says there shouldn’t be a tunnel here at all.
I knew that thing would be useless.
Not necessarily — maybe this tunnel is new.
It looks exactly as old as the others. Face it, you got sold a pup when you bought that thing.
It doesn’t look like there’s any other way out. Let’s get back to the Doctor.
FX: THEY START WALKING BACK
(WALKING) So.. is this the sort of story you usually cover?
(WALKING) Not exactly. But then, this isn’t the sort of story that comes along every day.

CAITLIN: I’m sorry... I’m so sorry. But they were taken by the rats!
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 74
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 33: INT. TARDIS CORRIDORS
SALLY: (WALKING) Where are we going, Turlough?
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) My bedroom, actually.
SALLY: (WALKING) Well that’s quite forward!
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) No, not that. I have something there that might help us. An item I picked up on another... well, let’s just say I picked it up on my travels. A place called ‘Purity’.
SALLY: (WALKING) What is it?
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) It’s a ‘sparkwire’ — a slightly more advanced defibrillator, essentially.
SALLY: (WALKING) You mean those things that hospitals use to restart hearts?
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) Yes, but it’s been tampered with. It’1ll shoot a charge — as it’s a medical device, I’m hoping the TARDIS might overlook it.
SALLY: That’s not very reassuring.
TURLOUGH: It gets less reassuring, believe me. There’s probably enough power for three small charges — or one large one. With luck, we’ll be able to knock out each of the rats before they can get close. But we’ll have to be careful.
SALLY: (WALKING) Why?
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) Because if we do it wrong, it’ll use all the energy at once. And that’s enough to kill either of us.
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 75
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 34: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS. THE CELL.
GUARD RAT: (TELEPATHICALLY) Stay here until you are summoned.
MUTOID: Wurrgh!!!
TEGAN: Could you throw me a little rougher next time? I don’t think you really tried hard enough!
TEGAN: Verminous creeps. Well this is great, Tegan. Another cell. How do you do it.
TEGAN: Hello? Who’s that? Is there someone else in here?
WALLACE: (WALKING) You’re.. real! You’re not a... dream?
TEGAN: I hope so! Who’s that? Come out of the shadows.
WALLACE: I’m sorry... it’s been so long since I spoke to a human being...
TEGAN: Good god! What happened to you? Those burns... those scars! The fur —You’re one of them! One of those human rats!
WALLACE: No, my mind is still my own, though I wonder if that’s a mixed blessing. As for my body? The rats... they like to play with me, torture me.
TEGAN: Play with you? It looks like they’re trying to kill you!
WALLACE: No, they want me alive, for as long as they can. They want me to see the world when they have finished with it.
TEGAN: But why?
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 76
WALLACE: Because my name is Doctor Christopher Wallace... And I created them!
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 77
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 35: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (DEEPER LEVEL)
DOCTOR: (RUNNING) Come on! We haven’t a moment to lose!
MATTHEW: (RUNNING) What about the lockdown? How do we get out?
DOCTOR: (RUNNING) I’m sorry, Matthew, but Tegan and Kevin’s safety is far more important than finding a way out for the moment!
CAITLIN: And maybe that other bloke will get some help.
DOCTOR: Mr Andrews? Maybe, but I wouldn’t bank on it.
MATTHEW: (RUNNING) But Doctor! We don’t know where Kevin and Tegan are, even! They could be anywhere! Now what are you doing?
DOCTOR: (TUTS) These batteries are going.
CAITLIN: Is that Kevin’s rucksack you’ve got? There should be spares in there.
DOCTOR: Good.
DOCTOR: Shine your torch in here, Matthew.
CAITLIN: Be careful, Doctor — There’s Nitro in there.
DOCTOR: No there isn’t — I left it back in the tunnel where you last saw us, under a crate, safely out of the way. Remind me to go and dispose of it properly before we leave... Batteries, batteries.. compass, no.. Dog whistle?
CAITLIN: In case there were security dogs. It was Kevin’s idea.
DOCTOR: You know that dog whistles call dogs to you? Not send them away?
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 78
CAITLIN: You met Kevin. What do you think?
DOCTOR: Fair point. Ah! Batteries.
DOCTOR: Now —
CAITLIN: Doctor! It’s the rats! Look! They’re the ones who took Tegan!
DOCTOR: Yes, it looks like they want to see what we’re doing. Slowly back away, Caitlin — we can go around them —
MUTOID: Wurrghhh!!!
MATTHEW: Argh! What the hell is that!
DOCTOR: I think it was human... but as for what it is...
CAITLIN: Whatever it is, it’s strong.
MATTHEW: (INTERRUPTING) Doctor! Rats — behind us!
DOCTOR: Ah. That’s inconvenient. (LOUDLY) Hello, I’m the Doctor. Who’s the leader here?
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) I am, Doctor. Security Rat Seven.
DOCTOR: Telepathic communication! Marvellous way to bypass those limited little squeaky vocal cords. Now look, we don’t want to be a nuisance, but I believe that you have two of our friends.
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 79
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) They have been taken for conversion. Our hybrids
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: are old. New humans must replace the old.
DOCTOR: I don’t like the sound of that.
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) You have been deemed a threat, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Have I? Always nice to be recognised.
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) You will be eradicated. Your humans will be converted.
MATTHEW: Converted to one of those? You mean you made them?
CAITLIN: Did you do that to everyone you found down here?
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) No. Some of them we killed.
DOCTOR: I wouldn’t come closer! I have nitro glycerine in this bag! move and boom!
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) I do not believe you.
CAITLIN: (MURMURING) Doctor...
DOCTOR: (SOFTLY) Don’t worry, I’ve been in tighter spots than this
DOCTOR: One
DOCTOR: before. All I need to do is to keep them talking while I work
DOCTOR: out a plan.
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) The time for talking is over, Doctor!
DOCTOR: Ah. Forgot how well rats can hear. (TO RATS) Look, if we could
DOCTOR: only discuss this...
SECURITY RAT SEVEN: (TELEPATHIC) Soldiers! Attack! Kill the Doctor and his allies!
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL)
MUTOID: WurrGGHHHH!!!
MUTOID: END OF PART TWO
MUTOID: Page 80
DOCTOR WHO: RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 81

elements.text: PART THREE
(SOFTLY) Don’t worry, I’ve been in tighter spots than this before. All I need to do is to keep them talking while I work out a plan.
(TELEPATHIC) The time for talking is over, Doctor!
Ah. Forgot how well rats can hear. (TO RATS) Look, if we could only discuss this...
(TELEPATHIC) Soldiers! Attack! Kill the Doctor and his allies!
FX: RATS SKREEE WITH DELIGHT
WurrGGHHHH! !!
FX: CAITLIN SCREAMS
CONTINUES INTO:
SCENE 36: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (DEEPER LEVEL)
Ah! One step closer — and I’1l1 blow on this!
(TELEPATHIC) First you threaten us with explosives, then a small silver whistle? Rats! Continue —
(INTERRUPTING) I really think that you should reconsider! This isn’t just a whistle — it’s a hypersonic dog whistle! If I blew on this, the pitch would be too high for us to hear... But for you...
(TELEPATHIC) What about us?

I’ve seen your enhancements. The small metal plate in your skull? A transcendal wavelength receiver. Your telepathy is nothing more than a communal wavelength broadcast, controlled by a central location!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 82
(TELEPATHIC) What does this mean to us?

The wavelength that connects you is the same one as this whistle. One blow and it’1ll sever your hive mind! We won’t hear it, but you’ll suffer the intense pain of cerebral feedback. If it doesn’t kill you, it’1ll drive you mad with pain.
(TELEPATHIC) (BEAT) Not believe you.
Well, don’t say I didn’t warn you. (TAKES A DEEP BREATH)
(FX: DOCTOR BLOWS THE WHISTLE, ALL WE HEAR IS ABOUT TWO SECONDS OF HIS BREATH RUSHING THROUGH IT)
(TELEPATHIC) Stop! Stop the whistle! What do you want?
Take your soldiers and back away.
(TELEPATHIC) Troops, to me. To me!
FX: SKITTERING
(WALKING) Caitlin, Matthew — come with me. (TO RATS) You rats — stay back! One puff from this and you’1l be back to squeaking for cheese...
FX: CLANG OF DOOR
Thank goodness.
Quick, Matthew, find me something to barricade this door with.
Right.
FX: A DESK DRAGS ALONG THE FLOOR
Why bar the door? If they come through, just blow the whistle again.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 83
I would, if it actually worked.
You lied?

Let’s just say that I... exaggerated a little. Those metal plates in the skull were designed for hive communication, but I have no idea where their telepathy came from. The theory’s sound, I think, but I’d need something more powerful and directed to make it work.
Hold on — why couldn’t they tell that you were lying? I mean, if they’re telepathic...
Psychic defences. I’ve kept out better mind-readers than them in my time. I realised when I threatened them with the explosives. They said they didn’t believe me... but they didn’t actually know.
Psychic rats.. how is that possible?

Matthew, the list of the impossible is growing every additional minute we stay down here. Those rats aren’t naturally evolved — the amount of proteins that would have to be mixed together to create such a hybrid, not to mention the surgery...
Someone did this to them?

It certainly looks that way. There might be a lot of rats down here, but there’s definitely a pied piper playing the tune somewhere in all this. The trouble is, what if the rats have learned the tune for themselves?
FX: DOCTOR CLIMBS DOWN A LADDER
Come on, down here. Wherever those rats took Tegan and Kevin, I’m sure it’s downward. No time to lose!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 84
SCENE 37: INT. TURLOUGH’S BEDROOM
FX: SOUND OF RUMMAGING
Come on, come on! Where are you?
Do you need any help?
No, I’m perfectly fine. I know it’s here, I just need to.. Aha! There you go — a Sparkwire!
FX: A BOX IS DRAGGED ALONG THE FLOOR
It doesn’t look like much.
It’s not designed to look good, it’s designed to work. I saw this destroy a...
FX: TURLOUGH TAPS THE DIAL A COUPLE OF TIMES
No no no! The power’s drained — there’s no charge!
Great. So it’s useless.
Not if we can charge it up — and I know just where to do that. Come on —
FX: A FAINT RAT SKREEE
Did you hear that?
(WALKING) Yes. Sounds like the rats have found a way through the door. We need to move!
(WALKING) Where to now?
(WALKING) To find the TARDIS’s equivalent of a plug socket.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 85
SCENE 38: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS, RAT LABORATORY
FX: WE’RE NEAR THE RAT KING, WITH TREADWHEEL RUNNING
(WALKING THROUGH WATER) Where are we?
(TELEPATHIC) These are the science laboratories of the Rat King. Here we create our plague, test it.
Test it? On what?
(TELEPATHIC) On who, more accurately. Humans that we have captured from the tunnels. Lab specimens.
Humans? You have hostages?
(TELEPATHIC) Did you call us hostages when you performed your experiments?
I never did such things.
(TELEPATHIC) Really? In all your tests, in all your searches for a cure, you never used another species? I see in your memories that you lie... the Crack..tids?
The Cractids? They were on Hellheim! That wasn’t me! I’ve searched for a cure! I haven’t experimented on anything!
FX: THE TREADWHEEL GETS LOUDER
What is that noise?
(TELEPATHIC) That is the treadwheel. It supplies our electricity.
(WALKING) (BEAT) There’s someone inside it!
(RUNNING ON TREADWHEEL) Help me, please! They keep shocking me when I slow down!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 86
You have to stop this! What did this man ever do to you?
(TELEPATHIC) If he stops — the power ceases. You will not be able to experiment. You will not be able to help us.
(SLOWING DOWN ON TREADMILL) Wait — what does he mean by ‘help us’? Are you on his side? You work for the rats!
No! It’s not what it looks like!
(STOPPING) When I get out of here, I swear I’1ll —
FX: SHOCK STICK STRIKES KEVIN
Arghhh! (STARTS TO RUN AGAIN) Can’t Tegan take over for a while?
Tegan? Is she here? Where is she?
(TELEPATHIC) We must leave this area. Your cubicle is this way.
No! Wait! Tell me — What happened to Tegan?
(TELEPATHIC) Scientist Twenty Seven, who and what is this?
(TELEPATHIC) Technician Fifteen — this is Nyssa of Traken. She is helping us. Like the other two.
(TELEPATHIC) She is human! She cannot be trusted!
(TELEPATHIC) She is not human. And she will be treated with accord while she is here. I need her to work on batch nineteen.
(TELEPATHIC) Does the King Rat agree with this?
(TELEPATHIC) Of course they do! Do you think me an addle- brained mouse? If you disbelieve, go ask them yourself!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 87
(TELEPATHIC) No, that is fine. Keep the human to the designated areas.
FX: LEAVES
(TELEPATHIC) Of course. Come with me, Nyssa.
(WALKING) Does the Rat King really know about me?
(TELEPATHIC) (WALKING) Of course not. They would want you for experimenting, breeding even. My virus suggestion is irrelevant to them.
(WALKING) Breeding?
(TELEPATHIC) Of course. More humans equals more specimens, more hybrid soldiers. Why look so shocked, Nyssa of Traken? Your kind has done the same to us for centuries. Come, my bench is this way...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 88
SCENE 39: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS. THE CELL.
It was supposed to be the dawn of a new age.
A new age of warfare, you mean.

Many of our greatest achievements came, came from warfare, you know. Airplanes during world war one, yes, Radar and satellite technology in world war two — Haha! Even Silly Putty — that’s right, Silly Putty came from such a thing.
Look, you need to sit down — you don’t look so good.
Silly Putty!
Yes. Silly Putty. Look, are you saying that war is good?
Of course not! But war, it pushes forward technology. And in the fifties, with a terrible war right behind us...
Yeah, you really look like you’ve put it behind you.
And we were preparing for the next one.
Why?
Twenty years between world war one and two? We assumed that in the sixties, it’d begin all over again, just in time for the next generation to forget the mistakes of the last.
But the war didn’t come, did it? Well, not in the way you expected? It was a secret war. The Cold War.
(PACING) Exactly. Russia became the threat, and we needed to know what their plans were. Spies became our front lines. Information became our ammunition.
But what does this have to do with rats? Because let’s face it, everything else can wait for the moment.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 89

We had an idea. An idea! To create spies that would never be considered. A rat in a building? A pest! But they’re clever animals — what if that rat could hear, see what was happening, disseminate the information, bring it back? The ultimate secret agent!
If I hadn’t seen it out there, I’d say you were mad.

I made a cocktail of amino acids and proteins and synthetic strings that, when injected made a radical advancement in rat genetics. And as the rats progressed, so did our ideas. A receiver dish to allow new orders to be sent remotely. Larger Size of the rat itself, to ensure survival against things like guard dogs...
Let me guess, it all went wrong. But if they took over and made you the prisoner, what happened to the others?

The rats’ humanoid servants. That’s all that’s left of my team. The rats had spent years watching what we did. They faked an accident — cleared the base of non-important personnel. The tunnels were closed and the humans waited for the air to clear. By the time it did, the rats had changed things, removed all knowledge of my project and the lower levels. They’d sealed it off, and anyone who knew about it had been captured, kept.
But surely the government would have known?

Oh, they did. But they believed that the lower levels were caved in, and that a plague pit had been opened up. Don’t want to play in a plague pit, no no. We were probably dead anyway, tell the families we died in an accident. Not worth the risk to come down here and check. Our work was so secret, even they didn’t know what it was half the time.
How long has this been going on?
Close to twenty years. My wife, my daughter, think I am dead.
You’ve never tried to get out?
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 90

I always thought it was for the best that I stay. I don’t want people to see me, know the mistakes I made... I made a lot you know. The rats, they enjoy reminding me of my mistakes... But now, with the tunnels being sold they want to leave, get out before it’s too late. They’re creating a virus to kill any humans that get in their way — and they’1ll have it ready any day now. I must get out and warn someone — but I can’t do it alone.
I’1ll help. Can you run?
I’1l damn well sprint if I have to.
Good. Now, here’s the plan...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 91
SCENE 40: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (DEEPER LEVEL).
(WALKING) It’s like a sewer down here.
(WALKING) Yes, it looks like there was a cave-in at some point — here, watch your footing on these steps, the top one is loose.
(WALKING) What I’d give if that was the only problem down here, eh! I mean —
FX: TUMBLE DOWN SOME STEPS
(STOPPING) Matthew! Are you all right?
(OFF) Yes, don’t worry, I’m fine. Just a few cuts and —
FX: THE FLOOR STARTS TO GIVE WAY BENEATH HIM
Look out, Matthew! The ground —
(OFF) Whoa — aaarrgh!
FX: THE FLOOR COLLAPSES, TAKING MATTHEW WITH IT
Matthew!
Get me a rope. I need to get down there.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 92
SCENE 41: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS, RAT LABORATORY
FX: CAVE-IN ALSO FELT HERE, DISTANTLY
What was that?
(TELEPATHIC) I do not know. I fear the Doctor is trying to rescue his friend. This will force the Rat King to move ahead with the plague. We must work fast.
Why not just let Tegan go? She’s nothing to do with this.
(TELEPATHIC) We will free her — after we have created this new compound. Now, what do you need?
But Tegan —
(TELEPATHIC) What would you rather do? Free your friend, or find a cure for your Richter’s Disease?

I.. you're right. I have to think of the many over the one. I need to see the enzyme that you claim stopped the destabilisation of your compound. I’1ll also need something I can use to draw some of my own blood to test it against.
(TELEPATHIC) Scientist Twenty Seven.
(TELEPATHIC) Technician Fifteen. What can I do for you?
(TELEPATHIC) Rat King sent me to bring the plague.
Why?
(TELEPATHIC) They wish to bring launch forwards. Latest batch will be tested on new woman.
Tegan?
(TELEPATHIC) Yes.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 93
But they can’t!
(TELEPATHIC) And why not?
She’s.. she’s been travelling with me! We’re time travellers!
(TELEPATHIC) Your human is mad, Scientist Twenty Seven.
(TELEPATHIC) Read her memories. She has been to other worlds and times.
(TELEPATHIC) If I believe you, human — why can’t this compound be used?
The temporal flux — it takes at least five hours for the body to settle and behave normally. Before then, you won’t get a reliable result.
(TELEPATHIC) I see. Then we will wait. Thank you.
SIGH OF RELIEF
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 94
SCENE 42: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS (SECRET LEVEL)
FX: FALLING MASONRY, DOCTOR DESCENDING ON ROPE
Don’t come too close to the edge, Caitlin — that might give way too.
(OFF) Can you see him, Doctor?
Yes. I’m just looking for a safe footing...
FX: DOCTOR LANDS ON RUBBLE
Matthew? Matthew...
(OFF) Is he all right?
(SIGHS) I’m sorry, Caitlin. The rocks came down on him, crushed him. He’s dead.
FX: CAITLIN COMES TO THE EDGE
What? But he can’t be. Have you checked —
I’m sorry. He’s gone.
He only came because of his stupid mid-life crisis... he felt like he’d sold out, joined the establishment... Are you coming back up?
No, I think you should come down.
Why?
There’s a whole new level down here. This must be where Tegan and Kevin were taken.
But Matthew...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 95
Matthew would have wanted us to save them. Come on, I’1l help you down.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 96
SCENE 43: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS, RAT CELL
FX: THE CELL DOOR IS HAMMERED ON
Guard! Quickly! I think the old man is having some kind of attack!
Ohhh! My heart!
FX: CELL DOOR OPENS
Wuurggh!!
(TELEPATHIC) Get back! Get away from the door!
Now, Tegan!
Hey, rat — what am I thinking?
(TELEPATHIC) Argh! The snake! Hide! Hide from the snake!
Quick! While he chases his tail!
FX: DOOR SLAMS. THEY DASH AWAY DOWN A CORRIDOR
Hehe! Rats in a trap! What if there’s more guards?
They’1l get more of the same.
What do you think of? To make them do that?

Something else got in my head once. Something powerful, a sort of snake. I just remember what that was like, and they think it’s in their heads. Snakes and rats, not great pals of course. This memory of the Mara seems to do well if we meet any.
That’s very clever.
Thanks. Come on, this way!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 97
SCENE 44: INT. TARDIS CORRIDOR
(RUNNING) Come on, Sally! They’re getting closer again!
FX: FAINT SKITTERING
(PAUSES) Maybe we should try to talk to them?
Do you remember what they did to Harris, Turlough?
Maybe not, then. Here, lean against this wall. If they come close, use the broom handle as a weapon.
And what will you be doing? Where are you going?
(OPENS A DOOR) There’s an archon feed to the time vortex here — it’s fiddly, but I should be able to rig up a quick charge for the sparkwire.
And then what? They won’t stop coming!
True — but if they see one of their own get shocked, they might take him away for medical attention, or even give up and leave.
They’re giant rats, Turlough!
Intelligent giant rats. And we have to hope that the intelligence part overcomes the whole ‘bite first, ask questions later’ part. Back ina bit.
FX: A DOOR SHUTS
Turlough? Turlough!
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 98
SCENE 45: INT. SECRET CADOGAN TUNNELS, DIARY ROOM
FX: A DOOR IS FORCED OPEN, DOCTOR AND CAITLIN ENTER
Hnnf — There!
(ENTERING THE ROOM) Where are we, Doctor? It looks like nobody’s been around here in decades.
During the war, this was a radar station, although latterly it seems to have been used as a dumping ground for old tapes and files.. help me shift these.
FX: THEY START SHIFTING BOXES
What for?
I’ve been thinking about the ruse with the dog whistle. The device needs to be significantly stronger.
You want a bigger dog whistle.
In a nutshell, yes. I should be able to cannibalise the radar for the parts I need.
What, and just knock up a gadget just like that?
Trust me, Caitlin — this isn’t my first time doing something like this.
FX: CAITLIN PICKS UP A TAPE
Doctor... look at this tape! ‘Nineteen Fifty Eight, Doctor Wallace Personal Diary’.
I don’t see the relevance —
Please, Doctor — I need to hear this. Is that a tape player?
A reel-to-reel recorder. If it still works —
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 99
FX: BLOWING DUST AWAY. TAKING OFF REEL THAT’S ON THERE
(COUGH) I wonder how long it’s been since this one’s been
played.
Why? What’s on it?
The Goon Show. Pass me your reel.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 100
SCENE 46: INT. CADOGAN TUNNELS, AWAY FROM CELLS
FX: THE ALARM CLAXON, LOUDER
(RUNNING) They know we’ve escaped!
(RUNNING) Then we’d better make every second count. This way, Wallace.
(STOPPING) But we can’t just leave — we have to stop them!
We need to find the Doctor before we can think about stopping them. Our chances are a hell of a lot better with him.
FX: SKITTERING
(WHISPER) Come on! Which way!
It’s been so long... I can’t remember...
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) I’d say you need to go that way.
Who are you?
Someone who can help you find the Doctor.
You’ve met the Doctor?
Yes, and I know where he is. Quick, we need to get out of here and fast — there’s a staircase down that corridor that takes us to the upper dormitory.
(WALKING) That’1ll do for me! Come on, Wallace! We need to —
(INTERRUPTING) No. It’s a trap.
(STOPPING) What?
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 101
That escape route, it’s a trap. It’ll take us right back to the rats.
And why would I do that?

Because you work for them, Mr Andrews. I’ve seen you. You might have thought I was unconscious, or too in pain to understand, but I saw you. And that woman of yours. Talking to the Rat King. You sold us out, a rat in every sense.
(FX: COCKS PISTOL) Ah.
The pistol tells me it’s true.
I’m afraid so. Now — be a good girl and do exactly what I tell you.
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 102
SCENE 47: INT. SECRET CADOGAN TUNNELS, DIARY ROOM
FX: REEL TO REEL RECORDER TURNING

(D) The aim of Project Piper is to create a breed of hyper- intelligent rats for use in chemical warfare, using a variety of hypertension proteins and a continual regime of radical shock therapy to create a non-epileptic super-breed.
Doctor Christopher Wallace...
Does that name mean something to you?
(D) Here, we plan to create a hive mind by linking together three enhanced rats by their tails to create a King Rat, a communications hub if you will for a genetically achieved super-rat hive mind.
That’s how the rats were created!
(D) Each hive rat will have a transcended wavelength receiver surgically implanted in their frontal lobe, allowing them to communicate via wavelength broadcast, controlled by a central location.
Thought as much.
But we don’t have those plates in our skulls, and we understand them.
No. The rats have clearly been working on it.

(D) (SIGHS) It is hard sometimes. I know they’re only rats. I don’t care about that. But to keep this all so secret, to not even be able to tell my wife and daughter what I do every day can be rather —
(FX: STATIC WIPE AS ANOTHER RECORDING CUTS IN, RECORDED OVER THE DIARY ENTRY)
(D) June the fifteenth. I’m currently opening up the frontal lobe of specimen fifteen...
RAT TRAP by Tony Lee (FINAL) Page 103
FX: CLINK OF A KNIFE INTO A DISH
(VIA TAPE RECORDER) Can you pass me the transducer? Thank you. And the receiver?
FX: SQUISHY ‘THINGS PUT IN EXPOSED BRAIN’ NOISE
